firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support the WeatherWise Dashboard application, focusing on real-time weather data, forecasts, user preferences, and favorite cities. The structure prioritizes authorization independence to ensure robust security rules and scalable operations. User-specific data is segregated under the `/users/{userId}` path for clear ownership and private access. City and Weather data are stored in top-level collections to allow simple querying.  Data that required collabroation uses the Membership Map (`members: {uid1: "role", uid2: "role"}`). The design enforces Authorization Independence via denormalization (Strategy A), Structural Segregation (Strategy B) and Access Modeling (Strategy C). Path-based ownership is used for user-owned data, while global data is placed in root collections.  QAPs is achieved via segregation of user data vs application data
